snsedextend package¶

Submodules¶

snsedextend.cc_extrap module¶

snsedextend.cc_extrap.extendCC(colorTable, colorCurveDict, outFileLoc='.', bandDict={'B': 'bessellb', 'I': 'besselli', 'H': 'paritel::h', 'K': 'paritel::ks', 'J': 'paritel::j', 'Ks': 'paritel::ks', 'R': 'bessellr', 'U': 'bessellux', 'V': 'bessellv', 'Z': 'sdss::z', 'g': 'sdss::g', 'i': 'sdss::i', 'r': 'sdss::r', 'u': 'sdss::u'}, colorExtreme='median', colors=None, zpsys='AB', sedlist=None, showplots=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

Function used at top level to extend a core-collapse SED.

Parameters:
  • colorTable (astropy.Table) – Colortable made by colorCalc.curveToColor
  • colorCurveDict (dict) – Dictionary of color curves, such as made by fitColorCurve
  • outFileLoc (str,optional) – Place you want the new SED to be saved, default current directory
  • bandDict (dict,optional) – sncosmo bandpass for each band used in the fitting/table generation
  • colorExtreme (str,optional) – ‘blue,’median’,’red’ describes which curve extreme to use
  • colors (list or None,optional) – Colors you would like to use for extrapolation
  • zpsys (str,optional) – Magnitude system
  • sedlist (list or None,optional) – list of SEDs to extrapolate, if None then uses all SEDs in SNDATA_ROOT
  • showplots (Boolean,optional) – If you would like to see plots as they’re extrapolated
  • verbose (Boolean, optional) – Printing on?
Returns:

Saves extrapolated SED to outFileLoc, and returns an sncosmo.Source SED from the extrapolated timeseries.
snsedextend.cc_extrap.createSNSED(filename, rescale=False)[source]¶

Creates an sncosmo.Source object from a timeseries source (flux in photons/s/cm^2 as in sncosmo,assumes the file is in ergs though)

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – Name of file containing the timerseries source
  • rescale (Boolean, optional) – If you want to rescale the flux so that it is in photons at the end instead of ergs (divides by ergs/AA
Returns:

ncosmo.Source object
snsedextend.cc_extrap.plotSED(sedfile, day, normalize=False, MINWAVE=3000, MAXWAVE=20000, saveFig=True, figFile=None, showPlot=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Simple plotting function to visualize the SED file.

Parameters:
  • sedfile (str) – SED filename to read
  • day (double or str (if all)) – The day you want to plot, or ‘all’
  • normalize (Boolean) – Boolean to normalize the data
  • MINWAVE (float) – Allows user to plot in a specific window, left edge
  • MAXWAVE (float) – Allows user to plot in a specific window, right edge
Returns:

None
snsedextend.cc_extrap.fitColorCurve(table, confidence=50, type='II', verbose=True)[source]¶

Fits color curves calculated in colorCalc module using BIC

Parameters:
  • table (astropy.Table) – colorTable from curveToColor function
  • confidence (double (2.5,25,50,75,97.5),optional) – Confidence interval
  • type (str,optional) – SN type
  • verbose (Boolean,optional) – Printing on?
Returns:

A dictionary containing colors from the colorTable input as keys, time/color vectors in astropy.Table format as values.

snsedextend.colorCalc module¶

snsedextend.colorCalc.mag_to_flux(table, bandDict, zpsys='AB')[source]¶

Accepts an astropy table of magnitude data and does the conversion to fluxes (flux in ergs/s/cm^2/AA)

Parameters:
  • table (astropy.Table) – Table containing mag, mag error error, and band columns
  • bandDict (dict) – translates band to sncosmo.Bandpass object (i.e. ‘U’–>bessellux)
  • zpsys (str,optional) – magnitude system
Returns:

astropy.Table object with flux and flux error added (flux in ergs/s/cm^2/AA)
snsedextend.colorCalc.flux_to_mag(table, bandDict, zpsys='AB')[source]¶

Accepts an astropy table of flux data and does the conversion to mags (flux in ergs/s/cm^2/AA)

Parameters:
  • table (astropy.Table) – Table containing flux, flux error error, and band columns
  • bandDict (dict) – translates band to sncosmo.Bandpass object (i.e. ‘U’–>bessellux)
  • zpsys (str,optional) – magnitude system
Returns:

astropy.Table object with mag and mag error added
snsedextend.colorCalc.curveToColor(lc, colors, bandFit=None, snType='II', bandDict={'B': 'bessellb', 'I': 'besselli', 'H': 'paritel::h', 'K': 'paritel::ks', 'J': 'paritel::j', 'Ks': 'paritel::ks', 'R': 'bessellr', 'U': 'bessellux', 'V': 'bessellv', 'Z': 'sdss::z', 'g': 'sdss::g', 'i': 'sdss::i', 'r': 'sdss::r', 'u': 'sdss::u'}, color_bands=['B', 'V', 'R', 'g', 'r'], zpsys='AB', model=None, singleBand=False, verbose=True, **kwargs)[source]¶

Function takes a lightcurve file and creates a color table for it.

Parameters:
  • lc (str or astropy.Table) – Name of lightcurve file you want to read, or astropy Table containing data
  • colors (str or list of strings) – Colors you want to calculate for the given SN (i.e U-B, r’-J)
  • bandFit (str,optional) – If there is a specific band you would like to fit instead of default
  • snType (str,optional) – Classification of SN
  • bandDict (dict,optional) – sncosmo bandpass for each band used in the fitting/table generation
  • color_bands (list,optional) – bands making up the known component of chosen colors
  • zpsys (str,optional) – magnitude system (i.e. AB or Vega)
  • model (str,optional) – If there is a specific sncosmo model you would like to fit with, otherwise all models mathcing the SN classification will be tried
  • singleBand (Boolean,optional) – If you would like to only fit the bands in the color
  • verbose (Boolean,optional) – If you would like printing information to be turned on/off
  • kwargs – Catches all SNCOSMO fitting parameters here
Returns:

colorTable: Astropy Table object containing color information
snsedextend.colorCalc.colorTableCombine(tableList)[source]¶

Takes a list of color tables generated from curveToTable and returns a concatenated table.

Parameters:tableList (list) – List of astropy.Table objects
Returns:Concatenated astropy.Table object
